intro: Asterolasia correifolia, commonly known as the Cape sugarbush, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid conditions, featuring a thick, waxy cuticle on its leaves to reduce water loss. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Asterolasia correifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
